revision.comment: HTTPS security. [[User talk:DemonDays64|Tell me]] if there's an issue with my edit. (via [[WP:JWB]])

{{Infobox concert tour | type = World | concert_tour_name = Justified World Tour | image = Justified World Tour.png | landscape = yes | image_size = 250px | border = yes | image_caption = Promotional banner for the 2004 leg | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' | start_date = {{start date|2003|05|07}} | end_date = {{start date|2004|06|19}} | number_of_legs = 4 | number_of_shows = 61 | this_tour = '''Justified World Tour'''
(2003–04) | next_tour = [[Justified and Stripped Tour]]
(2003) }} '''Justified World Tour''' (also known as the '''Justified and Lovin' It Live'''{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/mcdonaldsr-and-justin-timberlake-team-up-for-us-and-european-concert-tour-72458062.html|title=McDonald's(R) and Justin Timberlake Team Up for U.S. and European Concert...|author=McDonald's Corporation|date=10 October 2003|work=prnewswire.com}}) was the debut [[concert tour]] by American singer-songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]]. The tour showcased material his debut studio album, ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' (2002). ==Background== In September 2003, [[McDonald's]] announced Timberlake as a new spokesmen for their "I'm Lovin' It" campaign. Timberlake recorded "[[I'm Lovin' It]]", to be featured in ads for the franchise, later expanded and released as a single in December 2003. McDonald's later announced they will sponsor a tour for Timberlake, following his successful North American tour with Christina Aguilera.{{cite web|url=https://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/09/03/1062548903741.html?from=storyrhs|title=Bubble-gum pop meets fast food for ad campaign|date=2003-09-04|accessdate=2008-12-23|last=Gotting|first=Peter|work=The Sunday Morning Herald|publisher= Herald and Weekly Times Ltd}} Timberlake stated, ''"I love what McDonald's is doing with the new 'i'm lovin' it' campaign and it's cool to be part of it [...] We share the same crowd -- people who like to have fun -- and that's what this new partnership and my European concert tour is all about."'' The tour begin with Timberlake playing intimate gigs at clubs and theatres in the United States and Australia before expanding to arenas in Europe.{{cite press release |title=McDonald's Teams With Justin Timberlake on European Concert Tour |url=http://www.prnewswire.co.uk/cgi/news/release?id=111425 |publisher=PRNewswire |date=2003-11-07 |accessdate=2008-12-23}} After select shows in the [[United Kingdom|U.K.]], Timberlake performed at local clubs and theatres following his performance in that city. ==Opening acts== *[[Lemar]] (Europe) (select venues) *[[Solange Knowles|Solange]] (United Kingdom) ==Set list== #"[[Rock Your Body]]" #"Right for Me" #"[[Gone ('N Sync song)|Gone]]" #"[[Girlfriend ('N Sync song)|Girlfriend]]" #"[[Señorita (Justin Timberlake song)|Señorita]]" #"Still on My Brain" #"Nothin' Else" #"[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]" #"Let's Take a Ride" #"Beatbox Interlude" #"Last Night" #"[[I'm Lovin' It (song)|I'm Lovin' It]]" #"Take Me Now" #"Take It from Here" #"[[Like I Love You]]" Source:{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/justin-timberlake/15661|title=JT returns to the UK|date=2003-12-03|accessdate=2008-12-23|work=NME|publisher=IPC Media}} ==Tour dates== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of concerts, showing date, city, country and venue |- !
